entry.title: Blogging with Jekyll and Github Pages

link.title: Blogging with Jekyll and Github Pages

entry.content:
Prerequisites

  • Have a GitHub account
  • Get Git installed
  • Get Jekyll installed
  • Install Bundler using gem install bundler

When you are ready

  1. Create a new repository on Github
  2. Use “[username].github.io” as your repo name (Remember to replace username with your OWN GitHub username)
  3. After creating the repository, you will be directed to a new page. For now, just leave it alone.
  4. From your terminal, create a new Jekyll site at ./myblog, then direct to the directory you just created (you can change “myblog” to whatever directory name you want) 
    $ jekyll new myblog
$ cd myblog
  5. Run the following commands (Don’t forget to replace “zzhiyuan98” with your username) 
    $ git init
$ git add .
$ git commit -m "Initial GitHub pages site with Jekyll"
$ git remote add origin https://github.com/zzhiyuan98/zzhiyuan98.github.io.git
$ git push --set-upstream origin master
  6. Refresh the page you got in step 3, and you should see your new commit
  7. Go to Settings -> Pages (Sidebar), and you should see this green box (If it’s blue, just wait for a few seconds and refresh the page) Click the url and boom! You have your brand-new blogging site all set!

Get your site running on a local server

bundle add webrick
bundle exec jekyll serve
entry.summary: Prerequisites Have a GitHub account Get Git installed Get Jekyll installed Install Bundler using gem install bundler
